page.title: 10CLUBS AND ENTERTAINMENT 02
page.content:
Cinemas are slowly dying out. Films are shown nearly every night. Normally one film is shown for two weeks. At the Royal Cinema in Cradley Heath there is also an arcade which is most popular with young people. It has games machines and snooker and pool. In our area there are also bingo clubs where prizes can be won. For young people there are youth clubs. Our school has a youth club with a disco.
On Saturday nights you can visit the speedway in Cradley Heath where motorbikes race round a track. It is also used for greyhound racing.
There is also a Civic Centre locally which holds dances and concerts and is the venue for Darby and Joan club meetings.
